page.title: 10HOUSING IN MELKSHAM
page.content: The oldest houses in Melksham are around St.Michael's church and were built in the 18th and 19th centuries. Some of the older houses have been altered so that they are exactly the same as they were. Melksham has some attractive limestone houses too. Building sites have recently been popping up all over the place. My friend Bradley lives opposite a building site in Bowerhill where 160 houses of different shapes and sizes are being built. On the by-pass there are new houses (mostly 3 and 4 bedrooms) which will be finished in 1990. Finally, on the site which used to be the feather factory, there are new red-bricked houses designed largely for first-time buyers.
